Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Normothermic Machine Perfusion in Liver Transplantation

Trial_Design.evidence: This multicenter randomised clinical trial was conducted at 20 US liver transplant programs from November 2016 to October 2019.

Participants.evidence: Participants were adults listed for liver transplant.

Intervention.evidence: Donor livers were randomised 1:1 to OCS or ICS.

Objective.evidence: This trial evaluates whether the Organ Care System (OCS) Liver, a portable normothermic machine perfusion system, reduces early allograft dysfunction (EAD) and ischemic biliary complications (IBCs).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was EAD incidence within 7 days posttransplant.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was via an Interactive Web Response System, with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not feasible for clinicians, but outcome assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 300 randomised participants, 151 received OCS and 142 received ICS.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The per-protocol analysis showed a significant reduction in EAD with OCS (18% vs 31%; P = .01).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The per-protocol analysis showed a significant reduction in EAD with OCS (18% vs 31%; P = .01).
